subject: feat(import): add pipe syntax and frontmatter connections to markdown import
body:
Markdown import previously limited connections to auto-generated
"contains" (heading hierarchy) and "links to" (wiki-links) arcs with
no labels or properties. This meant all enriched connection metadata
required JSON format, undermining the recommended Markdown workflow.

Pipe syntax: [[Target|relationship title]]
  - Splits on first "|" â€” left = target name, right = relationship title
  - No pipe = default "links to" (backward compatible)
  - Example: [[Google|works at]] creates a "works at" arc

Frontmatter connections: block
  - Parsed from section-level YAML frontmatter
  - Each entry: to: (required), title: (optional), labels: (optional),
    plus any other key becomes a connection property
  - Example: connections: [{to: Acme, title: works at, role: CTO}]

Also fixes:
  - `tags:` now accepted as alias for `labels:` in frontmatter
    (guide told AIs to use `tags:` but code only recognized `labels:`)
  - `tags` and `connections` excluded from node properties (reserved keys)

16 new tests added (231 total, all passing).
Guide updated with both features: rules, template, tips, real-world
example, quick reference table, and connection metadata section.
